meanings.sent1: The itinerating circus performers amazed the audience with their constant movement.
meanings.sent2: The family's itinerating lifestyle allowed them to explore many different cities.
meanings.sent3: The itinerating penguins in the zoo always keep visitors entertained.
meanings.sent4: Her itinerating thoughts never stayed in one place for long.
meanings.sent5: The itinerating clouds painted a beautiful picture in the sky.

meanings.sent1: We will be itinerating across Europe next summer.
meanings.sent2: The explorer loved itinerating through uncharted territories.
meanings.sent3: The cat itinerated around the house, looking for its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: His mind itinerated back to the memories of his childhood.
meanings.sent5: The river itinerated through the valley, carving a path along the way.

meanings.definition: The act of moving from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The itinerating of goods from the warehouse to the store was efficient.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the itinerating involved in her job as a travel blogger.
meanings.sent3: The itinerating of students in the school hallway created a bustling atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The itinerating of ants along the trail fascinated the young child.
meanings.sent5: The itinerating of the planets around the sun is a marvel of the universe.
